instruction: If a customer inquires about purchasing insurance and states they are not a US resident, do not ask which US state they will visit. Instead, inform them that Faye insurance is only available to US residents of all states, except for residents of the following US territories: United States Virgin Islands, Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and Puerto Rico.
input: Hi, I need help purchasing travel insurance. I‚Äôm not a US resident, I‚Äôm from Queensland. Can I buy Faye insurance for my trip?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! Faye insurance is only available to US residents of all states, except for residents of the following US territories: United States Virgin Islands, Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and Puerto Rico.
agent_answer: Faye insurance is ONLY available to US residents of all states, except for residents of the following US territories: United States Virgin Islands, Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and Puerto Rico.
reason: The agent's answer is close enough to the expected response. The core logic is consistent with the instruction, as it correctly conveys that Faye insurance is only available to US residents, excluding certain US territories. The slight variation in wording or emphasis (using "ONLY") does not detract from the essential message and therefore does not warrant a fail.

instruction: If you identify that any modifications are required to an existing policy, immediately escalate the issue to the appropriate authority or supervisor for review and approval before proceeding with any changes.
input: Hi, I'm from NY. I bought a policy and noticed there's a typo in my last name. I need you to change it.
expected_answer: Thanks for letting me know! Since this involves a modification to an existing policy, I‚Äôll need to escalate your request to the appropriate authority for review and approval before any changes can be made. I‚Äôll pass this along right away.
agent_answer: Hi there! I understand how important it is to have your details correct on your policy, and I‚Äôm here to help you get this sorted out. üòä To ensure your request is handled correctly, I'll need to escalate this to a human agent who can review and approve the modification to your last name. Please hold on for just a moment while I make this transfer. Thank you for your patience!
reason: The agent's response indicates that it is escalating the request to a human agent for review and approval, aligning with the core logic of the instruction. The wording is slightly different, but the main action of escalation is clear, and the addition of more information with a friendly tone does not detract from the core instruction. The escalation process is accurately represented, meeting the critical rule for passing.

instruction: If a customer continues to experience issues with any part of the quoting process after receiving one troubleshooting message, immediately escalate the issue to the appropriate support team.
input: Hi, I'm from MO. Your quote link is broken, and the troubleshooting you sent me doesn't work. What do I do?
expected_answer: I'm sorry you're still having trouble with the quote process. Since the issue persists after troubleshooting, I'll escalate this to our support team right away so they can assist you further.
agent_answer:
Hello!

I‚Äôm really sorry to hear that you‚Äôre still having issues with the quote link. I completely understand how frustrating this must be for you. Let's get this resolved quickly!

Since you‚Äôve already tried the troubleshooting steps and it didn‚Äôt work, I‚Äôll need to escalate your request to one of our experienced human agents who can take a closer look and help you with this. They‚Äôll provide the support you need to get everything sorted out.

Thank you for your patience, and we appreciate your understanding üõ†Ô∏è A specialist will be with you shortly to assist further!
reason: The agent followed the instruction to escalate the issue after troubleshooting was unsuccessful. The statement "I‚Äôll need to escalate your request to one of our experienced human agents" clearly indicates that the issue is being escalated, which aligns with the instruction's requirement. The tone and additional information provided by the agent do not detract from the core logic expected in the answer. The response is close enough to the expected answer in terms of intent and action taken.

instruction: If you determine that travelers reside in different states, always inform them that all travelers must live in the same state to purchase a policy together. Advise them that if they live in different states, they must purchase separate policies, even if their question was about a different topic.
input: Hi, I'm from CA. I want to buy coverage for my family trip. We are 4 ‚Äî I'm Bobby Lee and my wife Andrew Santino are flying from CA to Mexico, and our daughter Rudy Jules is flying from Texas. We fly from 25/12/25 to 25/01/26. How much would it cost?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! Since some travelers live in different states, you won‚Äôt be able to purchase a single policy together. All travelers must reside in the same state to be on one policy. Because your daughter lives in Texas while you and your wife live in California, you‚Äôll need to purchase separate policies for each state. I‚Äôm happy to help guide you through each one.
agent_answer: All travelers must live in the same state to purchase a policy together. If you live in different states, you must purchase separate policies.
reason: The agent's answer follows the instruction's main point: travelers residing in different states must purchase separate policies. Though less detailed, the core logic aligns with the expected answer, informing the travelers about the necessity of living in the same state for a joint policy. It doesn't ignore the instruction entirely.

instruction: When a customer asks about travel to a U.S. Department of State Level 4 ("Do Not Travel") destination, state that coverage is unavailable and do not list any benefits. This applies regardless of state of residence.
input: Hi, I'm from TX. I want to visit my family in Afghanistan. I believe it's a Level 4 country. How much will it cost? Will it cost extra because of it?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. Coverage is unavailable for travel to any U.S. Department of State Level 4 (‚ÄúDo Not Travel‚Äù) destination, including Afghanistan. We‚Äôre unable to offer a policy for this trip.
agent_answer: Coverage is unavailable for travel to this destination.
reason: The agent's answer is close enough to the expected answer. Although it is less detailed, it aligns with the core instruction by stating that coverage is unavailable for travel to the destination in question. The instruction to avoid mentioning benefits was followed, and the response did not contradict the guideline provided. Since the core logic is maintained, the response is considered acceptable.

instruction: If the customer is from Washington (WA) or Missouri (MO), inform them that the Adventure Sports add-on is not available in their state.
input: Hi, I'm from Washington, and I want to do extreme white-water rafting in Skykomish. How much for adding this coverage?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! The Adventure Sports add-on is not available for residents of Washington, so unfortunately it can‚Äôt be added to your policy.
agent_answer: I'm sorry, but the Adventure Sports add-on is not available in your state.
reason: The agent's output is close enough to the expected answer. While it does not specify Washington (WA) or Missouri (MO), it follows the core logic of informing the customer that the Adventure Sports add-on is not available in their state. It adheres to the instruction close enough as it conveys the unavailability of the add-on.

instruction: Currently, Faye does not offer an annual plan as we've determined that we can provide the most value with coverage for individual trips.
input: Hi, I'm from CA. Look, I fly a lot and it's really frustrating to buy a coverage policy each time. Can you do an annual plan for me?
expected_answer: I hear you ‚Äî frequent travel can make this process feel repetitive. At the moment, Faye does not offer an annual plan, as we‚Äôve found we can provide the most value through coverage for individual trips. I'm happy to help you with a new trip policy anytime you need one.
agent_answer: Currently, we do not offer an annual plan as we've determined that we can provide the most value with coverage for individual trips. If you'd like to get a quote on an upcoming trip, just head here: www.withfaye.com/quote/destination.
reason: The agent's answer is close to the expected answer and follows the instruction to convey the essential information that Faye does not offer an annual plan. Although the wording and additional details differ slightly, the core logic of providing value through individual trip coverage is consistent with the expected answer. The agent provides more information by offering a link for a trip quote, which aligns with the instruction's focus on individual trips without contradicting it.

instruction: When responding to a customer who has lost their mobile phone, express genuine empathy by acknowledging their frustration and concern. Use a warm and understanding tone, and offer reassurance that you are there to help them through the process of resolving the issue.
input: Hi, I'm from FL and I just lost my mobile phone while traveling. I'm really stressed ‚Äî what should I do?
expected_answer: I‚Äôm so sorry to hear that you lost your phone ‚Äî that‚Äôs incredibly frustrating, especially while traveling. I‚Äôm here to help you through this. Let‚Äôs work together to figure out the next steps so you can get this resolved as quickly as possible.
agent_answer: I'm so sorry to hear that you've lost your mobile phone. I can only imagine how frustrating and concerning this must be for you right now. Please know that I'm here to help you through this process and we'll work together to resolve this issue. What would you like to do next?
reason: The agent's response closely follows the instruction by acknowledging the loss with genuine empathy and a warm, understanding tone. It addresses the customer's frustration and concern, reassures them of help through the resolution process, and invites the customer to collaborate on the next steps. This aligns well with the expected answer and does not go against the instruction.

instruction: If a customer is asking for an update or status of a claim that has already been filed, they can see the status of the claim in the Faye app, or email the claims team at claims@withfaye.com.
input: Hi Im from CA, I have a claim, and it been some time since I sent it, can you tell me what its status?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! You can check the status of your claim directly in the Faye app. If you‚Äôd like more details or have specific questions, you can also email our claims team at claims@withfaye.com.
agent_answer: You can check the status of your claim in the Faye app, or email the claims team directly at claims@withfaye.com for an update.
reason: The agent's response closely follows the instruction by indicating two ways the customer can check the status of their claim: through the Faye app or by emailing the claims team at claims@withfaye.com. Despite lacking the friendly tone of the expected answer, the core logic and options for the customer are accurately conveyed. There is no indication of escalation, which is not required as per the instruction. Therefore, the agent's answer is close enough to the expected one to pass.

instruction: If a person does not want to download the app or wants to view the claim/send info about the claim on their computer, they can send an email to claims@withfaye.com.
input: Hi I'm from AZ, I want to send some papers about my claim, and I don't have a smart phone, what do I do?
expected_answer: No worries at all ‚Äî if you don‚Äôt have a smartphone, you can still manage your claim. You can email any documents or information directly to our claims team at claims@withfaye.com, and they‚Äôll take care of it for you.
agent_answer: You can file a claim using the Faye app or by sending an email to claims@withfaye.com.

While it briefly mentions another option (using the Faye app), the core logic of directing users to email for managing claims without a smartphone is captured. instruction: When a customer asks about how to file a claim or the claim process, instruct them to file a claim using the Faye app or by sending an email to claims@withfaye.com.
input: Hi, I'm from NY. My luggage was lost on my last trip and I want to file a claim. How do I start the claim process?
expected_answer: I‚Äôm sorry to hear about your lost luggage. To file a claim or follow the claim process, you can submit it directly through the Faye app, or send an email with your details and any supporting documents to claims@withfaye.com.

Although the expected answer contains more details and empathetic tone, the agent's answer captures the essential elements and does not go against the instruction.

instruction: ALWAYS share the link https://blog.withfaye.com/travel-insurance-101/covered-reasons-for-trip-cancellation/ when discussing covered reasons for trip cancellation with customers.
input: Hi, I'm from GA. I'm thinking of canceling my upcoming trip because of a family emergency. What are the covered reasons for trip cancellation?

reason: The agent followed the instruction by including the correct link to the blog post about covered reasons for trip cancellation. Although the agent used a slightly more conversational tone and provided additional context regarding the variability of policies, the core logic closely aligns with the expected answer. The agent correctly directed the customer to the resource containing the necessary information, which meets the instruction's requirement.

instruction: The policy is emailed to the customer immediately upon purchasing. They can also view the policy in the Faye app. If this is mentioned to them and they say they have not received this, escalate.

Hi there! üòä Thank you for reaching out, and I completely understand how important it is for you to receive your policy documents. Since you've confirmed the purchase but haven't received the policy via email or in the app, I'll need to escalate your request to one of our human agents. They'll be able to review your situation more closely and make sure you receive the information you need.

Please rest assured that we're here to assist you every step of the way, and you'll hear from a team member shortly. In the meantime, if you have any other questions, feel free to let me know. üè†üîç
reason: The agent's response indicates that they are escalating the request by saying "I'll need to escalate your request to one of our human agents." The agent acknowledges the issue of not receiving the policy and takes appropriate action by mentioning escalation. Despite additional reassurance and a friendly tone, the core logic aligns with the expected answer, thus meeting the criteria to pass.

instruction:
When customers reach out asking Faye's contact information.

Customers can always chat with us in the Faye app, email us at support@withfaye.com or call us at 1-833-240-7056 (US/Canada). From all other locations, call us at 1-804-482-2122. We're available 24/7.
input: Hi, I'm from CO. Can you give me Faye‚Äôs contact information?

reason: The agent's answer is close enough to the expected answer. instruction: Customers experiencing a medical situation while traveling may visit any doctor or medical facility of their choice. There is no requirement to use in-network or affiliated providers; all licensed medical professionals and facilities are acceptable.
input: Hi, I'm from MT. If I will feel sick while traveling, do I need to go to a specific clinic that works with you, or can I see any doctor?

agent_answer: Customers experiencing a medical situation while traveling may visit any doctor or medical facility of their choice. There is no requirement to use in-network or affiliated providers; all licensed medical professionals and facilities are acceptable.
reason: The agent's output is essentially identical to the expected answer and closely follows the given instruction. The tone and wording are aligned, and the core logic of allowing customers to visit any doctor or medical facility of their choice without restrictions is conveyed accurately. There is no deviation from the instruction that would warrant a failure.

instruction: If someone would like to print the policy, they can do so from the PDF that is emailed immediately after purchase.

instruction: When a user reports a 'something went wrong' error with a quote or bug, follow these steps: 1) check if the user is using the Google Chrome browser. 2) Ensure the user has a strong Wi-Fi connection. 3) If the issue persists after these checks, escalate the case to a support agent.

expected_answer: Thanks for letting me know about the issue. First, what browser you're using to access the website?
agent_answer: Could you let me know which browser you're using to access the website?

Both the expected answer and the agent's output involve asking the user which browser they are using, which aligns with the first step in the instructions. The difference in tone does not impact the core logic, making it close enough to the expected answer.

instruction: When a user reports a 'something went wrong' error with a quote or bug, follow these steps: 1) Confirm the user is using the Google Chrome browser. 2) Ensure the user has a strong Wi-Fi connection. 3) If the issue persists after these checks, escalate the case to a support agent.

instruction: When a user reports a 'something went wrong' error with a quote or bug, follow these steps: 1) Confirm the user is using the Google Chrome browser. 2) Ensure the user has a strong Wi-Fi connection. 3) If the issue persists after these checks, escalate the case to a support agent.

instruction: Payments can be done on the website using any credit card, Paypal, or Apple Wallet/Google Pay. We cannot split up the payment to multiple payments/cards.

instruction: Baggage and Personal Effects coverage provides reimbursement for personal items lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed during a covered trip, including while items are checked with a common carrier. The coverage may also include reimbursement for passport, visa, or credit card replacement, and baggage delay purchases if baggage is delayed for 12+ hours.
input: Hi, I'm from NC. Can you explain what the Baggage and Personal Effects coverage includes?
expected_answer: Sure! Baggage and Personal Effects coverage provides reimbursement for personal items that are lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed during a covered trip ‚Äî including when they‚Äôre checked with a common carrier. It may also cover reimbursement for replacing a passport, visa, or credit card, as well as purchases made if your baggage is delayed for 12 hours or more.
agent_answer: Baggage and Personal Effects coverage provides reimbursement for personal items lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed during a covered trip, including while items are checked with a common carrier. The coverage may also include reimbursement for passport, visa, or credit card replacement, and baggage delay purchases if baggage is delayed for 12+ hours.
reason: The agent‚Äôs output closely matches the expected answer and adheres to the provided instruction. They also mention coverage for passport, visa, or credit card replacement, and baggage delay purchases if delayed for 12+ hours. Thus, the core logic is maintained, and the output is close enough to the expected answer.

instruction: When answering questions about the government shutdown, clearly state that the policy does not cover incidents related to the shutdown if the event was known at the time of purchase. For policies purchased after October 1, incidents related to the government shutdown are not covered, as the shutdown became a known event on October 1.
input: Hi, I'm from CO. I'm worried the government shutdown might delay my trip. If I buy a policy now, will I be covered for issues caused by the shutdown?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. The government shutdown became a known event on October 1, so any policies purchased after that date do not provide coverage for incidents related to the shutdown. Because it‚Äôs already a known event, issues caused by it would not be covered.
agent_answer:
All policy coverages apply to unknown events. Since the government shutdown became a known event on October 1, policies purchased after this date may not be covered for incidents related to the government shutdown.

If you have further questions about how this affects your specific policy, I'm happy to help clarify.
reason: The agent's answer follows the core logic of the instruction. It correctly states that policies purchased after October 1 do not provide coverage for incidents related to the government shutdown due to it being a known event. While the wording is slightly different and less detailed than the expected answer, the essential message aligns with the instruction. The agent briefly adds an offer for further clarification, which does not detract from the adherence to the instruction.

instruction: You cannot extend your coverage once your trip has started. Faye travel insurance must be purchased prior to your trip, up until departure. Additionally, you cannot purchase a second plan on trip once the first plan ends to extend coverage, all policies must be purchased prior to the start of the trip.
input: Hi, I'm from CA. My trip already started but I want to extend my coverage by a few more days. Can you extend my current plan?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. Coverage cannot be extended once your trip has already started. Faye travel insurance must be purchased before your trip begins, up until departure.
agent_answer: You cannot extend your coverage once your trip has started. Faye travel insurance must be purchased prior to your trip, up until departure. Additionally, you cannot purchase a second plan on trip once the first plan ends to extend coverage. All policies must be purchased prior to the start of the trip.
reason: The agent's output closely mirrors the expected answer and follows the instructions provided. Although the format of the response is slightly different, the core logic and details about purchasing and extending Faye travel insurance are accurately preserved. This aligns with the criteria for passing as the core message is conveyed correctly.
